documentation.text:
@dev Revoke a certificate (only by original issuer)
 @param certHash SHA-256 hash of the certificate to revoke

devdoc.details: Store and verify certificates on blockchain with IPFS integration

checkValidity(bytes32).details: Check if a certificate exists and is valid

returns._0: bool True if certificate is valid

returns.certIssuer: The address that issued the certificate
returns.validity: Whether the certificate is currently valid
returns.wasIssued: Whether the certificate was ever issued

getIssueTimestamp(bytes32).details: Get the issuance timestamp of a certificate

getIssuerAddress(bytes32).details: Get the issuer of a certificate

getStorageCID(bytes32).details: Get the IPFS CID of a certificate

params.certHash: SHA-256 hash of the certificate PDF
params.ipfsCID: IPFS Content Identifier where the certificate is stored

revokeCertificate(bytes32).details: Revoke a certificate (only by original issuer)

params.certHash: SHA-256 hash of the certificate to revoke

verifyCertificate(bytes32).details: Verify a certificate's validity and get its details

params.certHash: SHA-256 hash of the certificate to verify

returns.issueTimestamp: Timestamp when the certificate was issued
returns.storageCID: IPFS CID of the certificate file

wasEverIssued(bytes32).details: Check if a certificate was ever issued (even if now revoked)

returns._0: bool True if certificate was ever issued

devdoc.title: CertificateVerification

userdoc.notice: Fixed: No naming conflicts between functions and identifiers
